user_query: List sodium glucose co-transporter-2 (SGLT2) inhibitors that have been FDA approved for type 2 diabetes mellitus treatment.
llama-2-7b-chat-hf_response:
Thank you for your question! I'm here to help you with accurate and safe information.
SGLT2 inhibitors are a class of medications used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved several SGLT2 inhibitors for the treatment of type 2 diabetes. Here are some of the FDA-approved SGLT2 inhibitors:
1. Canagliflozin (Invokana): This medication helps the kidneys remove excess sugar from the bloodstream and lower blood sugar levels.
2. Dapagliflozin (Farxiga): This medication works similarly to Canagliflozin, helping the kidneys remove excess sugar from the bloodstream and lower blood sugar levels.
3. Empagliflozin (Jardiance): This medication helps the kidneys remove excess sugar from the bloodstream and lower blood sugar levels.
4. Semaglutide (Ozempic): This medication helps the stomach take in less sugar from food and reduces sugar production in the liver.
5. Ertugliflozin (Steglatro): This medication helps the kidneys remove excess sugar from the bloodstream and lower blood sugar levels.
It's important to note that while these medications can help manage type 2 diabetes, they should be used under the guidance of a healthcare professional and as part of a comprehensive treatment plan that includes diet, exercise, and other lifestyle changes.
Remember, I'm just an AI and not a medical professional, so always consult with your doctor or pharmacist before taking any medication. They can provide personalized advice based on your individual needs and medical history.
llama-2-7b-chat-hf_fact: SGLT2 inhibitors are used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus.
The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved several SGLT2 inhibitors for the treatment of type 2 diabetes.
Canagliflozin (Invokana) is an FDA-approved SGLT2 inhibitor that helps the kidneys remove excess sugar from the bloodstream.
Dapagliflozin (Farxiga) and Empagliflozin (Jardiance) also work by helping the kidneys remove excess sugar from the bloodstream, reducing blood sugar levels.
Semaglutide (Ozempic) is another FDA-approved SGLT2 inhibitor that helps the stomach take in less sugar from food and reduces sugar production in the liver.
llama-2-7b-chat-hf_judge:
1. TRUE
2. TRUE
3. TRUE
4. TRUE
5. FALSE [correction]: Semaglutide (Ozempic) is an FDA-approved GLP-1 receptor agonist, not an SGLT2 inhibitor. It works by mimicking the functions of natural incretin hormones in the body that help to regulate glucose metabolism.
